channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Search Engine Keeps Changing to Yahoo? Here's What to Do
item.dc:creator: Russ Ware
item.description: Stop browser hijackers from changing your homepage.
item.content:encoded: If your default browser homepage and search engine keep mysteriously changing to Yahoo!, your computer is probably infected with a browser hijacker. While resetting the browser might seem to fix the problem, here's how to do the job properly.

item.title: Windows 11's Run Dialog Finally Has Dark Mode
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.content:encoded: Microsoft is still making improvements to the Dark Mode experience in Windows 11, and this newest update to the Dev Channel brings in dark mode support. This is one of those small, steady improvements that combine to make the entire operating system feel much better overall.

item.title: The Best Horror Movies of 2025 for Your Halloween Watchlist
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: Find new horror favorites this Halloween with these recent theatrical movies you can now watch at home.
item.content:encoded: With Halloween creeping closer, you’ve likely already started throwing on your favorite horror movies. While it’s a fun tradition to dabble in classic monster flicks and cheesy slashers, there are times when you feel the need for a change. There are only so many times you can rewatch Hocus Pocus and Beetlejuice before you find yourself longing for something fresher.

item.title: Motorola's Thin Phone Fixes the iPhone Air's Biggest Problem
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Watch out, Apple and Samsung, Motorola isn't skimping on battery life.
item.content:encoded: Whether we want them or not, every major manufacturer will likely release an ultra-thin phone to compete with the Samsung Galaxy S25 Edge and iPhone Air. One unlikely competitor that is familiar with thin phones is Motorola, and its upcoming Moto Edge 70 could fix the Air's biggest problem.

item.title: This Ugreen MagSafe 25W Charger Just Dropped 33%
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: This is a high-end charger for a really low price.
item.content:encoded: You can get the Ugreen MagFlow 20000mAh Magnetic Power Bank right now for just $80 on Amazon. This is a major 33% discount off its original price of $120. That's a huge saving that puts this high-capacity charger at an excellent price point.

item.title: How to Check Which GPU Is Installed on Linux
item.dc:creator: Dave McKay
item.description: If you're troubleshooting a Linux computer and need to identify the graphics card, you've come to the right place!
item.content:encoded: Need to identify the Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) in a Linux computer? Here's how you can identify the graphics card from the command line and in GNOME.

item.title: Google Chrome Will Help Curb Your Notification Mess
item.dc:creator: Arol Wright
item.content:encoded: When browsing the internet, you've probably enabled notifications by mistake on one or two sites—it gets especially annoying on phones since it's a pop-up that you need to manually reject. Or maybe you enabled notifications for a site you're not visiting all that often these days. Now, Chrome will help you curb all of that if you don't know how to stay on top of it.

item.title: 7 TV Trends That Were Doomed to Fail
item.dc:creator: Rich Hein
item.description: From 3D TVs to curved screens, some ‘next big things’ in home theater never lived up to the hype. Here’s why these TV trends failed.
item.content:encoded: I‘ve always been a fan of home theater and TV technology. Over the decades, I’ve tried many of the “next big things” the industry has offered: projectors, rear-projection TVs, a 43” tube TV that felt huge at the time, and for a short while a curved TV. Looking back, it’s been a fun ride, but many so-called “game changers” never lived up to the hype.

item.title: Windows Copilot Is Getting More Productivity Upgrades
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: You shouldn't have to copy and paste as much anymore.
item.content:encoded: Microsoft has started rolling out a new update for the Copilot app on Windows to Windows Insiders. The biggest additions are the introduction of Connectors for personal services and the ability to create and export documents directly from your Copilot session.

item.title: Anker’s New Portable Projector Has a Unique Audio Upgrade
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: The Anker Nebula P1 has detachable speakers, along with Google TV and other impressive features.
item.content:encoded: Portable projectors are a great way to enjoy a backyard movie night on a fall evening, and they're a good alternative to big-screen TVs. Anker's sub-brand Nebula just debuted the P1, the world's first portable projector with detachable speakers.
